p: Considering that Peru will have to comply with a 31% reduction in its GHG emissions by 2030 in the frame of the Paris Accord, it is surprising to see that none of the reductions included in the Nationally Determined Contributions (NDCs) proposed by the Peruvian government are linked to seeking changes in Peruvian dietary patterns. In fact, the only NDCs aimed at reducing GHG emissions in the agricultural sector sum up to approximately 1.45 Mt CO 2eq per year, a minor contribution considering a total reduction of 82.2 Mt CO 2eq per year that is projected for 2030 [ 26]. Hence, we hold that food production and distribution should play a more important role in the national strategy to reduce GHG emissions.
